content.question: Which of the following best explains the status of media freedom in Iran?

choices.label: Iranian clerics control all outlets and use various media platforms to deliver religious messages.
The government controls the Internet but allows freedom of all other media sources because a free press is written in the constitution.
There is some media censorship, but the government allows independent news sources as a way to maintain legitimacy.
The government allows complete freedom of all media sources as a way to look more democratic to international organizations.

content.answer: There is some media censorship, but the government allows independent news sources as a way to maintain legitimacy.
